result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amy Lynn Segerson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Amy Lynn Segerson in court.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: STW 
Case set for Jury Trial.  Defense request an adjournment. For reasons presented to the Court. Case adjourned, branch 30.
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for January 3, 2022 at 09:00 am.
States Witness List, received and filed.

Defendant Amy Lynn Segerson not in court.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn appeared by video for Amy Lynn Segerson. Attorney Tishberg appeared by video along with a member of the victim's family.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a status conference. Defendant's appearance waived for reasons placed on the record. State filed a motion for joinder on 22CM1179. Defense objects. Court GRANTS State's motion.
State to file new witness list. Case in trial posture and will be tried with 22CM1179. Jury trial scheduled for September 26th, 2022 at 9:00am.
Jury trial scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with KH and AB.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision. 
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Amy Lynn Segerson in court with attorney Corey Flynn as a friend of the court.  Sarah Dahdouh appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amy Lynn Segerson appeared by video means with Attorney.
Defense counsel waived reading of the Complaint and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant. Defendant is public defender eligible and Attorney Flynn is awaiting appointment.  Status conference scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Amy Lynn Segerson in court with attorney Corey Flynn who appears as a friend of the Court .  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amy Lynn Segerson appeared by video means with Attorney.
Case in court for initial appearance. For reasons stated on the record, Court orders case adjourned. Case remains calendared in Br 30.  Initial appearance scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
